answers.definition: Having interest in; participating in something.
answers.sentence: Luis dropped out of the club, but his brother is still an active member.
A surprising number of animals are active at night, including opossums, raccoons, and porcupines

wrongs: Extremely lethargic; sleepy.
Ravenous, starving.
Noxious, having a terrible smell.
Deafeningly loud.

answers.sentence: The activity that Spencer likes best is playing word games on the Internet.
The food booths had a great deal of activity during last Saturday's fall festival.

wrongs: Staying extremely still.
Boredom.
Having a lush green color.
Noise.

answers.definition: A person who plays roles in movies, television shows and on stage; a performer.
answers.sentence: That actor played a pilot in one movie and a detective in another.

wrongs: Someone who wakes people up as a profession.
A person who is extremely rich.
Someone who is always moving about frantically.
A person who likes or is drawn to mysteries.

answers.sentence: I thought I would finish the thirty-minute test in fifteen minutes, but actually I took the entire half hour.

wrongs: How something feels, but is not really.
Done in a way that is always moving about.
Done in an entertaining manner for an audience.
In an annoying manner.

answers.sentence: Our congressman worked to enact a bill that would bring more money to the schools.

answers.definition: To act out a part in a play.
answers.sentence: Kit will enact the role of Dorothy in The Wizard of Oz.

wrongs: To pretend in a way that is convincing.
To try to get something to happen for real.
To eliminate something that is burdensome.
To try and learn a challenging skill.

answers.definition: A person with an important position in a particular group, such as a club or the armed services.
answers.sentence: The Student Council has four officers -- president, vice-president, secretary, and treasurer.
At the car accident, one officer directed traffic and another talked to the two drivers.

wrongs: A person who disables electronics from consuming electricity.
A nosy person, a busybody.
A person who does work generally seen as undesireable.
A Pokemon.

answers.definition: A person who holds an office or is in a position of authority such as a mayor, a referee, or a diplomat.
answers.sentence: Our top city official is Mayor Ramos.

wrongs: Someone who removes insects from humans or animals.
A person in charge of keeping food or drinks very cold.
An animal trainer.
A builder of Yo-Kai watches.

answers.definition: To supervise a special event or game.
answers.sentence: Out English teacher, Ms. Mason, will officiate at the state spelling bee.

wrongs: To remove the ruts and grooves that have accumulated on a rink.
To consume food when or where it is not expected.
To get all the answers correct in a test or quiz.
To yell loudly at various people even when they aren't paying attention.
